class.name: Nesting Information
class.description: Nesting Information tags are intended to contain other tags.

class.name: Nested Information
class.description: Nested Information includes tags contained in other tags.

tag.name: ORIGINAL
tag.description: A special tag that is meant to have other tags inside (using nested tags) to describe the original work of art that this item is based on. All tags in this list can be used "under" the ORIGINAL tag like LYRICIST, PERFORMER, etc.

tag.name: SAMPLE
tag.description: A tag that contains other tags to describe a sample used in the targeted item taken from another work of art. All tags in this list can be used "under" the SAMPLE tag like TITLE, ARTIST, DATE_RELEASED, etc.

tag.name: COUNTRY
tag.description: The name of the country ([biblio ISO-639-2](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/English_list.php)) that is meant to have other tags inside (using nested tags) to country specific information about the item. All tags in this list can be used "under" the COUNTRY_SPECIFIC tag like LABEL, PUBLISH_RATING, etc.

tag.name: TOTAL_PARTS
tag.description: Total number of parts defined at the first lower level. (e.g. if TargetType is ALBUM, the total number of tracks of an audio CD)

tag.name: PART_NUMBER
tag.description: Number of the current part of the current level. (e.g. if TargetType is TRACK, the track number of an audio CD)

tag.name: PART_OFFSET
tag.description: A number to add to PART_NUMBER when the parts at that level don't start at 1. (e.g. if TargetType is TRACK, the track number of the second audio CD)

tag.name: TITLE
tag.description: The title of this item. For example, for music you might label this "Canon in D", or for video's audio track you might use "English 5.1" This is akin to the TIT2 tag in ID3.

tag.name: SUBTITLE
tag.description: Sub Title of the entity.

tag.name: URL
tag.description: URL corresponding to the tag it's included in.

tag.name: SORT_WITH
tag.description: A child element to indicate what alternative value the parent tag can have to be sorted, for example "Pet Shop Boys" instead of "The Pet Shop Boys". Or "Marley Bob" and "Marley Ziggy" (no comma needed).

tag.name: INSTRUMENTS
tag.description: The instruments that are being used/played, separated by a comma. It SHOULD be a child of the following tags: ARTIST, LEAD_PERFORMER or ACCOMPANIMENT.

tag.name: EMAIL
tag.description: Email corresponding to the tag it's included in.

tag.name: ADDRESS
tag.description: The physical address of the entity. The address SHOULD include a country code. It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: FAX
tag.description: The fax number corresponding to the tag it's included in. It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: PHONE
tag.description: The phone number corresponding to the tag it's included in. It can be useful for a recording label.

tag.name: ARTIST
tag.description: A person or band/collective generally considered responsible for the work. This is akin to the [TPE1 tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TPE1).

tag.name: LEAD_PERFORMER
tag.description: Lead Performer/Soloist(s). This can sometimes be the same as ARTIST.

tag.name: ACCOMPANIMENT
tag.description: Band/orchestra/accompaniment/musician. This is akin to the [TPE2 tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TPE2).

tag.name: COMPOSER
tag.description: The name of the composer of this item. This is akin to the [TCOM tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TCOM).

tag.name: ARRANGER
tag.description: The person who arranged the piece, e.g., Ravel.

tag.name: LYRICS
tag.description: The lyrics corresponding to a song (in case audio synchronization is not known or as a doublon to a subtitle track). Editing this value when subtitles are found SHOULD also result in editing the subtitle track for more consistency.

tag.name: LYRICIST
tag.description: The person who wrote the lyrics for a musical item. This is akin to the [TEXT](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TEXT) tag in ID3.

tag.name: CONDUCTOR
tag.description: Conductor/performer refinement. This is akin to the [TPE3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TPE3).

tag.name: DIRECTOR
tag.description: This is akin to the [IART tag in RIFF](https://sno.phy.queensu.ca/~phil/exiftool/TagNames/RIFF.html).

tag.name: ASSISTANT_DIRECTOR
tag.description: The name of the assistant director.

tag.name: DIRECTOR_OF_PHOTOGRAPHY
tag.description: The name of the director of photography, also known as cinematographer. This is akin to the ICNM tag in Extended RIFF.

tag.name: SOUND_ENGINEER
tag.description: The name of the sound engineer or sound recordist.

tag.name: ART_DIRECTOR
tag.description: The person who oversees the artists and craftspeople who build the sets.

tag.name: PRODUCTION_DESIGNER
tag.description: Artist responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a movie.

tag.name: CHOREGRAPHER
tag.description: The name of the choregrapher

tag.name: COSTUME_DESIGNER
tag.description: The name of the costume designer

tag.name: ACTOR
tag.description: An actor or actress playing a role in this movie. This is the person's real name, not the character's name the person is playing.

tag.name: CHARACTER
tag.description: The name of the character an actor or actress plays in this movie. This SHOULD be a sub-tag of an `ACTOR` tag in order not to cause ambiguities.

tag.name: WRITTEN_BY
tag.description: The author of the story or script (used for movies and TV shows).

tag.name: SCREENPLAY_BY
tag.description: The author of the screenplay or scenario (used for movies and TV shows).

tag.name: EDITED_BY
tag.description: This is akin to the IEDT tag in Extended RIFF.

tag.name: PRODUCER
tag.description: Produced by. This is akin to the IPRO tag in Extended RIFF.

tag.name: COPRODUCER
tag.description: The name of a co-producer.

tag.name: EXECUTIVE_PRODUCER
tag.description: The name of an executive producer.

tag.name: DISTRIBUTED_BY
tag.description: This is akin to the IDST tag in Extended RIFF.

tag.name: MASTERED_BY
tag.description: The engineer who mastered the content for a physical medium or for digital distribution.

tag.name: ENCODED_BY
tag.description: This is akin to the [TENC tag](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TENC) in ID3.

tag.name: MIXED_BY
tag.description: DJ mix by the artist specified

tag.name: REMIXED_BY
tag.description: Interpreted, remixed, or otherwise modified by. This is akin to the [TPE4 tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TPE4).

tag.name: PRODUCTION_STUDIO
tag.description: This is akin to the ISTD tag in Extended RIFF.

tag.name: THANKS_TO
tag.description: A very general tag for everyone else that wants to be listed.

tag.name: PUBLISHER
tag.description: This is akin to the [TPUB tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TPUB).

tag.name: LABEL
tag.description: The record label or imprint on the disc.

tag.name: GENRE
tag.description: The main genre (classical, ambient-house, synthpop, sci-fi, drama, etc). The format follows the infamous TCON tag in ID3.

tag.name: MOOD
tag.description: Intended to reflect the mood of the item with a few keywords, e.g. "Romantic", "Sad" or "Uplifting". The format follows that of the TMOO tag in ID3.

tag.name: ORIGINAL_MEDIA_TYPE
tag.description: Describes the original type of the media, such as, "DVD", "CD", "computer image," "drawing," "lithograph," and so forth. This is akin to the [TMED tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TMED).

tag.name: CONTENT_TYPE
tag.description: The type of the item. e.g. Documentary, Feature Film, Cartoon, Music Video, Music, Sound FX, ...

tag.name: SUBJECT
tag.description: Describes the topic of the file, such as "Aerial view of Seattle."

tag.name: DESCRIPTION
tag.description: A short description of the content, such as "Two birds flying."

tag.name: KEYWORDS
tag.description: Keywords to the item separated by a comma, used for searching.

tag.name: SUMMARY
tag.description: A plot outline or a summary of the story.

tag.name: SYNOPSIS
tag.description: A description of the story line of the item.

tag.name: INITIAL_KEY
tag.description: The initial key that a musical track starts in. The format is identical to ID3.

tag.name: PERIOD
tag.description: Describes the period that the piece is from or about. For example, "Renaissance".

tag.name: LAW_RATING
tag.description: Depending on the `COUNTRY` it's the format of the rating of a movie (P, R, X in the USA, an age in other countries or a URI defining a logo).

tag.name: ICRA
tag.description: The [ICRA](http://www.icra.org/) content rating for parental control. (Previously RSACi)

tag.name: DATE_RELEASED
tag.description: The time that the item was originally released. This is akin to the TDRL tag in ID3.

tag.name: DATE_RECORDED
tag.description: The time that the recording began. This is akin to the TDRC tag in ID3.

tag.name: DATE_ENCODED
tag.description: The time that the encoding of this item was completed began. This is akin to the TDEN tag in ID3.

tag.name: DATE_TAGGED
tag.description: The time that the tags were done for this item. This is akin to the TDTG tag in ID3.

tag.name: DATE_DIGITIZED
tag.description: The time that the item was transferred to a digital medium. This is akin to the IDIT tag in RIFF.

tag.name: DATE_WRITTEN
tag.description: The time that the writing of the music/script began.

tag.name: DATE_PURCHASED
tag.description: Information on when the file was purchased (see also [purchase tags](#commercial)).

tag.name: RECORDING_LOCATION
tag.description: The location where the item was recorded. The countries corresponding to the string, same 2 octets as in [Internet domains](https://www.iana.org/whois), or possibly [ISO-3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html). This code is followed by a comma, then more detailed information such as state/province, another comma, and then city. For example, "US, Texas, Austin". This will allow for easy sorting. It is okay to only store the country, or the country and the state/province. More detailed information can be added after the city through the use of additional commas. In cases where the province/state is unknown, but you want to store the city, simply leave a space between the two commas. For example, "US, , Austin".

tag.name: COMPOSITION_LOCATION
tag.description: Location that the item was originally designed/written. The countries corresponding to the string, same 2 octets as in [Internet domains](https://www.iana.org/whois), or possibly [ISO-3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html). This code is followed by a comma, then more detailed information such as state/province, another comma, and then city. For example, "US, Texas, Austin". This will allow for easy sorting. It is okay to only store the country, or the country and the state/province. More detailed information can be added after the city through the use of additional commas. In cases where the province/state is unknown, but you want to store the city, simply leave a space between the two commas. For example, "US, , Austin".

tag.name: COMPOSER_NATIONALITY
tag.description: Nationality of the main composer of the item, mostly for classical music. The countries corresponding to the string, same 2 octets as in [Internet domains](https://www.iana.org/whois), or possibly [ISO-3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html).

tag.name: COMMENT
tag.description: Any comment related to the content.

tag.name: PLAY_COUNTER
tag.description: The number of time the item has been played.

tag.name: RATING
tag.description: A numeric value defining how much a person likes the song/movie. The number is between 0 and 5 with decimal values possible (e.g. 2.7), 5(.0) being the highest possible rating. Other rating systems with different ranges will have to be scaled.

tag.name: ENCODER
tag.description: The software or hardware used to encode this item. ("LAME" or "XviD")

tag.name: ENCODER_SETTINGS
tag.description: A list of the settings used for encoding this item. No specific format.

tag.name: BPS
tag.description: The average bits per second of the specified item. This is only the data in the Blocks, and excludes headers and any container overhead.

tag.name: FPS
tag.description: The average frames per second of the specified item. This is typically the average number of Blocks per second. In the event that lacing is used, each laced chunk is to be counted as a separate frame.

tag.name: BPM
tag.description: Average number of beats per minute in the complete target (e.g. a chapter). Usually a decimal number.

tag.name: MEASURE
tag.description: In music, a measure is a unit of time in Western music like "4/4". It represents a regular grouping of beats, a meter, as indicated in musical notation by the time signature.. The majority of the contemporary rock and pop music you hear on the radio these days is written in the 4/4 time signature.

tag.name: TUNING
tag.description: It is saved as a frequency in hertz to allow near-perfect tuning of instruments to the same tone as the musical piece (e.g. "441.34" in Hertz). The default value is 440.0 Hz.

tag.name: REPLAYGAIN_GAIN
tag.description: The gain to apply to reach 89dB SPL on playback. This is based on the [Replay Gain standard](http://www.replaygain.org/). Note that ReplayGain information can be found at all TargetType levels (track, album, etc).

tag.name: REPLAYGAIN_PEAK
tag.description: The maximum absolute peak value of the item. This is based on the [Replay Gain standard](http://www.replaygain.org/).

tag.name: ISRC
tag.description: The [International Standard Recording Code](http://www.ifpi.org/isrc/isrc_handbook.html#Heading198), excluding the "ISRC" prefix and including hyphens.

tag.name: MCDI
tag.description: This is a binary dump of the TOC of the CDROM that this item was taken from. This holds the same information as the MCDI in ID3.

tag.name: ISBN
tag.description: [International Standard Book Number](https://www.isbn-international.org/)

tag.name: BARCODE
tag.description: [EAN-13](https://www.gs1.org/standards/barcodes/ean-upc) (European Article Numbering) or [UPC-A](http://www.uc-council.org/) (Universal Product Code) bar code identifier

tag.name: CATALOG_NUMBER
tag.description: A label-specific string used to identify the release (TIC 01 for example).

tag.name: LABEL_CODE
tag.description: A 4-digit or 5-digit number to identify the record label, typically printed as (LC) xxxx or (LC) 0xxxx on CDs medias or covers (only the number is stored).

tag.name: LCCN
tag.description: [Library of Congress Control Number](https://www.loc.gov/marc/lccn.html)

tag.name: IMDB
tag.description: [Internet Movie Database (IMDb)](https://www.imdb.com/) identifier. 'tt' followed by at least 7 digits for Movies, TV Shows and Episodes.

tag.name: TMDB
tag.description: [The Movie Database (TMDb)](https://www.themoviedb.org/) identifier. The variable length digits string MUST be prefixed with either "movie/" or "tv/".

tag.name: TVDB
tag.description: [The TV Database (TheTVDB)](https://www.thetvdb.com/) identifier. Variable length all-digits string identifying a TV Show.

tag.name: PURCHASE_ITEM
tag.description: URL to purchase this file. This is akin to the WPAY tag in ID3.

tag.name: PURCHASE_INFO
tag.description: Information on where to purchase this album. This is akin to the WCOM tag in ID3.

tag.name: PURCHASE_OWNER
tag.description: Information on the person who purchased the file. This is akin to the [TOWN tag in ID3](http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0#TOWN).

tag.name: PURCHASE_PRICE
tag.description: The amount paid for entity. There SHOULD only be a numeric value in here. Only numbers, no letters or symbols other than ".". For instance, you would store "15.59" instead of "$15.59USD".

tag.name: PURCHASE_CURRENCY
tag.description: The currency type used to pay for the entity. Use [ISO-4217](https://www.xe.com/iso4217.php) for the 3 letter currency code.

tag.name: COPYRIGHT
tag.description: The copyright information as per the copyright holder. This is akin to the TCOP tag in ID3.

tag.name: PRODUCTION_COPYRIGHT
tag.description: The copyright information as per the production copyright holder. This is akin to the TPRO tag in ID3.

tag.name: LICENSE
tag.description: The license applied to the content (like Creative Commons variants).

tag.name: TERMS_OF_USE
tag.description: The terms of use for this item. This is akin to the USER tag in ID3.
